lexUnit.name: scream.v

corpus.description: Wall Street Journal Texts from the PropBank Project
corpus.name: PropBank

lexUnit.definition: COD: make a long, loud, piercing cry or sound, especially expressing extreme emotion or pain.

sentence.text: I 'm a virgin ! she screamed silently .
Part of her wanted to stop and stare , entranced by the sight : the rest of her screamed silently in the darkness .
She felt , abruptly , as if she were screaming silently inside .
At the same time Antoinette will scream loudly again and again .
She screamed loudly , but it was a bellow of rage not helplessness .
The bald man screamed loudly at Ivan .
Despair shook her , her body screaming silently at the pain of leaving him , choosing not to think of the risk he had taken to be with her .
David Lawrence could be heard screaming from 80 yards away .
That was Jane , screaming from the supper room 's entrance .
It was raining hard now , and the wind was screaming from the back of the ship .
Parrots and enormous butterflies , vivid as hallucinations , darted through the greenish air ; monkeys swung screaming from branch to branch two hundred feet overhead .
It was an Arctic blast screaming from the east , picking up extra degrees of cold as it drove over the frozen white surface .
It was situated beyond a winding dirt track on top of a hill , and the car repeatedly slid across the road , its engine screaming in protest .
Its engines scream in decline .
The engine screamed and the car shot forwards .
A Jaguar source said : ` The engine screamed and there was something of a bang .
But she forced the Volvo into first , the engine screaming as she drove fifteen or twenty yards down the road .
First , flashing through the gathering dark , a fire-engine screamed past the window of the Spinners ' .
Jack saw the ambulance tearing down the factory service road , siren screaming , lights blazing .
The alert sirens screamed .
Now there was another noise -- a police siren screamed into the car park and in a minute there were people everywhere , rushing out of the shop and crowding round the crumpled car .
The wind screamed , the hurricane hailed stones and branches .
The wild wind screamed , and shook the glass .
The wind screamed incessantly .
Here the River Neva is at its incredible widest , and the cold wind screams across the ice to the Peter and Paul fortress .
The rain crashed against the windows , and the wind screamed like an animal in the night .
The wind screaming and the rain lashing on the windows sent me into a reverie .
In the black night outside , the wind screamed , and the big waves crashed against the rocks , again and again and again .
The card screamed it all .
When their children scream hungrily from inside the damp , overcrowded , concrete houses is it money or mayhem that the apple conjures ?
But as Christine was leaving the orphanage to take the blood sample to Bucharest , she heard a child screaming .
In one case a woman waited three quarters of an hour with her child screaming with an open wound .
The child screamed and sobbed , and Jack 's face , usually so impassive , twisted with pain .
A child screaming is expressing itself , or like those artists who daub things in the West -- they say they are expressing themselves . "
The event had just started when a woman screamed .
He pulled her to the ground and indecently assaulted her but abandoned the attack after the woman screamed and bit him several times on one hand .
There would be policemen , the local reporter , tearful Aboriginal women screaming abuse at her at the bus stop .
Then a door opened behind him , and a woman screamed .
Then a woman screamed , and all the lights came on again .
The woman screamed when a man got in beside her .
Then to her right , a woman screamed .
A woman screamed over to his right .
A woman screamed , high and loud .
The tall man screamed with pain , slumping forward , Newman 's hand came down , nails jabbing into the back of the half-withdrawn hand .
A girl screams and screams .
The girls screamed ; some gritted their teeth , others stayed cool as if nothing worried them .
It is very flattering to have the girls screaming for you , " he says .
But when the girl screamed Floyd immediately gave up his attempt and tried to shake hands with her .
Girls screamed over Rock Hudson and Jimmy Dean while they were out cruising Boystown .
Once you are inside , no one can hear you scream .
One of the radio control room operators heard her screaming in uncontrollable agony over the airwaves .
I have learned to keep going , wrote Harsnet ( typed Goldberg ) , even when the voices scream at me to stop , to lie down , to turn to something else .
I was shocked , I felt sick , I screamed .
The gull screamed .
She screamed , more in rage than pain , but she was tiring , and her father managed to control her struggles .
She closed the door and dragged herself wearily up the stairs ; as she pushed open her bedroom door she screamed in fright when a dark figure materialised out of the gloom .
Jesus screamed with pain and surprise .
He screamed as loudly as his horse that was now blocking the high road with its failing death throes .
Tallis screamed at Scathach to hurry .
He screamed and almost lost his footing as he made for the stairs .
My screams of terror awoke my parents and brought them rushing in panic to my room .
Somewhere behind her , Atrimonides was screaming in pain above a babble of voices .
Often they would not kill quickly , but leave the would-be escaper screaming through the night until the guards came after sunrise , with guides , to retrieve the body .
As the helpers screamed with laughter , the kids , half asleep and baffled , were not amused !
One woman says she heard him scream as the Wheel rolled down the slope . "
Please -- go away ! " he screamed , so loudly that neighbours came to the window to investigate .
Amazingly , Penkovsky had n't screamed , but many of those watching had screamed in their dreams every night for months afterwards .
I screamed again .
Isabel screamed again , twisting her head from side to side , catapulted brutally into panic-stricken hysteria .
Blood burst from the shattered digit and Benton screamed again .
A fractious baby screamed in the heat as its tired young mother tried desperately to soothe him and an old woman dressed in peasant black sat stoically beside her wicker basket , knitting .
The man screamed , fell off his seat , and rolled down the aisle to the front .
Screaming under his breath , Bowring hacked it in half , then went on chopping , chopping , chopping .
When I 'm watching rugby on the TV and the children are running about like savages , screaming for attention .
Apart from all the weird letters I get from Scotsman readers , there are continuous phone calls to my house , maniacal voices who scream hoarsely about deadlines and copy .
I realized what was happening and screamed into the house for the dogs .
